intro: Stilpnopappus pohlii, commonly known as the Pohli's thistle, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually lanceolate and covered with fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a dense cluster. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
